page.title: 09Children's games.
page.content: "Going out to play" continues to be an alternative for children between 9-13 to TV, video or computers. Where the choice of a leader or a target is involved, rhymes play an important part. Players form a circle and one speaks the rhyme, touching each participant's fist or shoulder in turn. The end of the rhyme marks the per5son selected. Here are two such rhymes in current use. Mickey Mouse is dead. He died last night in bed. He cut his throat on a ten pound note, And this is what he said: Red White and Blue, The Queen hasd got the 'flu. The King has got the chicken-pox, And out goes you. The "YOU" retires from the circle aand the rhyme repeated until only one remains.
